result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Alex McDonald

defendant.name: McDonald, Alex
defendant.address: PO Box 31, c/o Kettle Moraine Correctional, Plymouth, WI 53073

records.addlTxt:
No contact with Minors
No access to devices that would allow the defendant to connect with the internet
Atty Renc to send the bond to her client

1:55 PM Defendant Alex McDonald appeared by video, in custody at Kettle Moraine Correctional.  Attorney Anne Renc in court for Alex McDonald.  Attorney Brian Pfeil in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Attorney/Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of the charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of the complaint.
Preliminary Hearing to be held within time limits.
Defendant wishes to appear via ZOOM for the Preliminary Hearing.
Court informs the defendant of his right to appear in person.

Court advises defendant of right to counsel/public defender representation.

State recommends a $50,000 cash bond with conditions as stated.
Atty Renc opposes the high cash bond and states her reasons on the record.
Court questions when the defendant will be released.

BY THE COURT: 
Defendant allowed to appear via ZOOM
Court will set a $10,000 cash bond with conditions as stated.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 7, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing on November 7, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
filed by Atty Anne Renc
